results.title: Geraldton
results.creator_credit: Christopher McCullough, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Geraldton, Western Australia, is a fast developing town as it is the major supply centre and port of the north of the state. A glimpse of the people, industries, such as building and crayfishing, and social life of Geraldton.

results.title: Fuel for thought
results.brief_description: Explains how to take fire precautions for houses in bush settings. Also gives details on how to prevent fire from spreading, how to fight a fire and what to do to avoid injury from a fire.
results.description: Explains how to take fire precautions for houses in bush settings. Also gives details on how to prevent fire from spreading, how to fight a fire and what to do to avoid injury from a fire.
description_for_label: Explains how to take fire precautions for houses in bush settings. Also gives details on how to prevent fire from spreading, how to fight a fire and what to do to avoid injury from a fire.

results.title: From the tropics to the snow
results.creator_credit: J Lee, R. Mason, Malcolm Otton, Stanley Hawes and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A tourist film of Australia. It is not a travelogue but a story combining humour with selling and entertainment with information; highlighting the difficulties of a producer, director and script-writer in the making of a short film which is to show all the tourist attractions of Australia. The film gently (and not so gently) laughs at all those aspects of the Australian way of life that are usually included in films about Australia, and also shows some of the not so well known attractions of the country. (Awards: Gold Award, Travel Category; Australian National Travel Association’s “Jedda Award”; Kodak Silver Award for colour photography, Australian Film Awards, 1965).

results.title: Freeway driving
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Emphasises the particular skills needed for safe use of freeways where road speed is greater than normal and driving dkills are different.

results.title: The Field day
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Adults Learning”.
A teaching aid to promote group discussion on the problems of the adult learning process in the management-staff relations. Shows a gathering at a rural agricultural field day. The film seems to be pointing out that resistance to new ideas is hard to overcome.

results.title: Driving to a system
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “How to Drive”.
The drills of the system of car control demonstrated have been well tried and are well proven; once memorised and understood, the system soon becomes an almost instinctive routine. The system is designed to ensure that at all times the car is in the right place on the road, travelling at the right speed for existing conditions, in the right gear, and the driver is never trying to do more than one thing at a time.

results.title: Double trouble
results.creator_credit: Lee Robinson, Geoffrey Bell and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Designed to establish cordial relations between Australians and migrants from Europe. Two Australian who criticise the newcomers’ lack of English find themselves in serious difficulties when magically transported to a foreign country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lee Robinson, Geoffrey Bell and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Forward communications
results.creator_credit: Bern Gandy and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Stresses that Australia’s vast distances make an efficient system of communication most essential. Shows how the Post Office is maintaining our present communications system at a high level of efficiency and also how the heavy post-war demand for new telephones and exchanges is being met.
